propositions.text: The narrator, Feng Yixi, is a 29-year-old Guangzhou native, working in Beijing, who experiences a series of terrifying and unimaginable events starting in 2004.
His name, Feng Yixi, is considered strange by the narrator, as "Yixi" sounds like "Yi Ming Gui Xi" (to die).
His father explained that his maternal uncle, a writer, gave him the name.
The narrator had a successful career, reaching the position of department manager in a foreign company, and was in a good relationship with his girlfriend, Han Wenna.
In early 2004, during a business trip to Hangzhou, the narrator visited Lingyin Temple.
He encountered a fortune teller outside the temple and, despite not being superstitious, was intrigued by the practice.
The fortune teller predicted great misfortune for the narrator based on the character '一' (one) that he wrote.
The fortune teller advised caution, good deeds, and going with the flow to overcome potential hardship.
Returning to Beijing, the narrator became addicted to gambling on football matches, losing heavily and accumulating a debt of over 400,000 yuan.
He lost all his savings, including money intended for his wedding and from his parents, leaving him with only a little over 1,000 yuan.
Devastated and ashamed, he broke up with Han Wenna via text message and fled to Tianjin.
In Tianjin, he sought refuge with his close friend Chai Yong, nicknamed 'Fei Lao' (Fatty), who works at a bank.
Fei Lao, despite his own wife being away, offered the narrator a place to stay and financial assistance.
The narrator found a cheap rental apartment in Tianjin, which was advertised as a 'fierce house' (凶宅) where someone had died.
Despite the ominous description, the narrator, driven by financial necessity and a sense of defiance, decided to rent it.
Upon entering the apartment, the narrator experienced a chilling sensation.
Fei Lao helped the narrator move in and clean the apartment.
While cleaning, they discovered a black and white photograph nailed to the inside of a cabinet with six long, rusty coffin nails, driven through the eyes, ears, nose, and mouth.
They identified the photograph as a 'will portrait' (遗像) and, out of respect, burned it.
The narrator had a disturbing experience where he felt drawn into the eyes of the woman in the photograph as it burned.
Later that evening, while drinking with Fei Lao, the narrator heard a woman's voice whispering about death.
He dismissed it as the effects of alcohol, but the voice persisted in his mind even after he returned to his room.
The narrator had a terrifying encounter with a 'hooking ghost' (勾死鬼) dressed in yellow, who attempted to strangle him.
He believes a sandalwood necklace, a gift from Han Wenna, protected him from the ghost.
The narrator decides to stay in the apartment despite its unsettling nature, attributing his previous experiences to stress or hallucination.
He learns about his neighbors, including a young woman named Liu Fengcai, a university student.
The narrator tells a frightening ghost story to his neighbors Yang Bin and Yang Qin, which scares them.
Fei Lao informs the narrator about a job opportunity and provides him with a new phone card.
Upon returning to his apartment late at night, the narrator sees Liu Fengcai squatting in the yard, which he initially misinterprets.
The next morning, the neighborhood is in an uproar because Liu Fengcai has gone missing.
The narrator had seen Liu Fengcai in the yard the previous night but doesn't immediately report it, fearing he was mistaken or that it's irrelevant.
While playing video games, the narrator and Yang Bin get caught in a 'ghost hitting wall' (鬼打墙) phenomenon, repeatedly encountering the same black garbage bin with the number 9999.
They attempt to escape by jumping over walls but find themselves back in the same alley.

concepts.name: Feng Yixi
concepts.context: Protagonist of the story, a 29-year-old man who experiences supernatural events.

concepts.name: Han Wenna
concepts.context: Feng Yixi's girlfriend, described as beautiful, model-like, kind, and good-natured.

concepts.name: Chai Yong (Fei Lao)
concepts.context: Feng Yixi's close friend in Tianjin, who helps him financially and with finding a job.

concepts.name: Lingyin Temple
concepts.context: A famous temple in Hangzhou visited by Feng Yixi.

concepts.name: Fortune teller
concepts.context: An old man Feng Yixi meets outside Lingyin Temple who predicts misfortune.

concepts.name: Gambling
concepts.context: Feng Yixi's addiction to football betting that leads to his financial ruin.

concepts.name: Fierce house (凶宅)
concepts.context: The apartment Feng Yixi rents in Tianjin, known to be a place where someone died.

concepts.name: Coffin nails
concepts.context: Found nailed to a photograph in the fierce house, adding to the ominous atmosphere.

concepts.name: Will portrait (遗像)
concepts.context: The burned photograph found in the apartment.

concepts.name: Hooking ghost (勾死鬼)
concepts.context: A supernatural entity that attempts to lure Feng Yixi to his death.

concepts.name: Sandalwood necklace
concepts.context: A protective amulet from Han Wenna that seemingly saves Feng Yixi from the ghost.

concepts.name: Yang Bin
concepts.context: A young boy Feng Yixi befriends in Tianjin, who helps him and gets caught in supernatural events.

concepts.name: Yang Qin
concepts.context: Yang Bin's older sister, who also rents an apartment in the same building.

concepts.name: Liu Fengcai
concepts.context: The daughter of Liu Shifu, a neighbor, who goes missing under mysterious circumstances.

concepts.name: Ghost hitting wall (鬼打墙)
concepts.context: A supernatural phenomenon where one is trapped in a loop, unable to find their way out.

concepts.name: Garbage bin (number 9999)
concepts.context: A recurring object in the 'ghost hitting wall' phenomenon.

main_topics: Narrator's misfortunes and descent into supernatural encounters
Supernatural events and their impact on the narrator
Themes of fate, superstition, and resilience
hierarchy.structure: The document is structured as a first-person narrative, presented in chapters, detailing the protagonist's personal downfall and subsequent immersion into a world of the supernatural. It follows a chronological progression of events, starting with his life in Beijing, his encounter with a fortune teller, his financial ruin due to gambling, his escape to Tianjin, and his experiences in a 'fierce house,' culminating in increasingly terrifying supernatural occurrences and a mystery involving a missing neighbor.
